titles.title: Mental Health Care Providers Bounty Prevention Act of 1994
To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit the practice by mental health care providers of using bounty hunters to attract patients for treatment.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E529)
Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime and Criminal Justice.

bill.summary: 3/23/1994--Introduced. Mental Health Care Providers Bounty Prevention Act of 1994 - Amends the Federal criminal code to prohibit, and set penalties with respect to, the intentional solicitation, receipt, or payment of remuneration for patient referrals to, or for purchasing, leasing, ordering, or arranging for any good, facility, or service from, mental health care providers.
